alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 28 at 1:47PM HST until January 28 at 3:45PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM HST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 500 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 140 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over the windward slopes of Haleakala, especially heavy between Nahiku and Kaupo. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... the entire island of Maui, but especially the Hana Highway and other windward areas. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 500 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. Rainfall and runoff will also cause hazardous driving conditions due to ponding, reduced visibility and poor braking action. A Flood Watch remains in effect.
